dhp146:0.3: While often translated as “aging” or “old age”, the contextual usage of the word _jarā_ in the suttas makes it clear that the meaning is “decay” or “decrepitude”
dhp146:1: The two metaphors in this verse seem mismatched. Perhaps they were originally two separate lines that were later conjoined.
dhp147:1: Taking _citta_ here in its ordinary meaning of “mind”. Other translators have interpreted this verse to be about the physical body; however, it reads perfectly well as a description of the mind.
